intro: Camarea, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-bearing inflorescences. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and colorful flowers. Camarea species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
